select
from grp join grp_path on(grp.id = grp_path.descendant) where grp_path.ancestor = #{ancestor,jdbcType=INTEGER} and grp.status=0

select t1.descendant, t1.ancestor from grp_path t1 join (select grp.id from grp join grp_path on (grp.id = grp_path.descendant) where grp_path.ancestor = #{ancestor,jdbcType=INTEGER} and grp.status=0) as t2 on t1.descendant = t2.id where t1.deepth=1 and t1.descendant <> #{ancestor,jdbcType=INTEGER}

select count(grp.name) from grp join ( select t1.descendant from grp_path t1 join (SELECT grp_path.ancestor as ancestor FROM grp_path where descendant=#{descendant,jdbcType=INTEGER} and deepth=1) t2 on t1.ancestor = t2.ancestor where t1.deepth=1) t3 on grp.id = t3.descendant where grp.status=0 group by grp.name having count(grp.name) > 1;

select count(g.id) from user u, user_grp ug, grp g, grp_path gp where u.status = 0 and u.id =#{userId,jdbcType=BIGINT} and u.id = ug.user_id and ug.type = 1 and ug.grp_id = gp.ancestor and gp.descendant = #{targetGroupId,jdbcType=INTEGER} and gp.descendant = g.id and g.status = 0

select distinct(gp.descendant) from grp_path gp join (SELECT ug.grp_id as p_grp_id FROM user_grp ug join grp on grp.id = ug.grp_id where ug.type=1 and ug.user_id=#{ownerId,jdbcType=BIGINT} and grp.status =0) pgid on gp.ancestor = pgid.p_grp_id join grp on grp.id = gp.descendant where grp.status=0
